head.title: 3 in Extortion Case Also Tied to Murder

hedline.hl1: 3 in Extortion Case Also Tied to Murder

block.p: Four men were charged with extortion and weapons violations in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday, as arrest warrants for three of them were issued in Los Angeles, charging them with two murders last year in Torrance, Calif.

The three men charged in both cases were identified as Gary Friedman, 39, a lawyer who lives at 7-27 152d Street in Whitestone, Queens; his 36-year-old brother, Kenneth, who is serving a sentence in a New York State prison on burglary and weapons convictions, and Ruben Hernandez, of 91-12 Vanderveer Street in Queens.

The three men charged in both cases were identified as Gary Friedman, 39, a lawyer who lives at 7-27 152d Street in Whitestone, Queens; his 36-year-old brother, Kenneth, who is serving a sentence in a New York State prison on burglary and weapons convictions, and Ruben Hernandez, of 91-12 Vanderveer Street in Queens.
The fourth defendant was Charles Sanchez, 28, of 138-70 Elder Avenue, Queens.
The four men pleaded not guilty at an arraignment yesterday before Magistrate Judge Steven Gold and were held for a hearing Friday.
